get.description: Fetches metadata for every dashboard page, including tiles and configured data sources.

200.description: All configured dashboard pages were successfully retrieved.

get.summary: Retrieve all pages

post.description: Creates a new dashboard page with the provided metadata and nested resources.

requestBody.description: Payload containing the page attributes to create.

201.description: The newly created page was returned successfully.

400.description: Invalid request data or unsupported page type

422.description: Page could not be created

get.description: Fetches the dashboard page identified by the provided UUID, including its tiles and metadata.

200.description: The requested dashboard page was retrieved successfully.

get.summary: Retrieve a specific page by ID

patch.description: Partially updates the metadata or layout of an existing dashboard page.

requestBody.description: Payload containing the updated page attributes.

200.description: The updated dashboard page was returned successfully.

400.description: Invalid UUID format, request data, or unsupported page type

422.description: Page could not be updated

delete.description: Deletes the dashboard page identified by the provided UUID.

400.description: Invalid request data or unsupported tile type

422.description: Tile could not be created

200.description: The requested tile was retrieved successfully.

get.summary: Retrieve a specific tile by ID

200.description: The updated tile was returned successfully.

400.description: Invalid UUID format, request data, or unsupported tile type

422.description: Tile could not be updated

delete.description: Deletes the dashboard tile identified by the provided UUID.

200.description: The requested data source was retrieved successfully.

requestBody.description: Payload containing updated data source attributes.

get.description: Fetches a list of all devices currently registered in the system. Each device includes its metadata (e.g., ID, name, and category), along with associated channels, controls, and properties.

200.description: A list of devices successfully retrieved. Each device includes its metadata (ID, name, category), associated channels, controls, and properties.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of available devices

post.description: Creates a new device resource in the system. The request requires device-specific attributes such as category and name. The response includes the full representation of the created device, including its associated channels, controls, and properties. Additionally, a Location header is provided with the URI of the newly created resource.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new device

201.description: The device was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created device, such as its unique identifier, name, category, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid request data or unsupported device type

422.description: Device could not be created

get.description: Fetches the details of a specific device using its unique ID. The response includes the devices metadata (e.g., ID, name, and category), associated channels, controls, and properties.

200.description: The device details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the devices metadata (ID, name, category), associated channels, controls, and properties.

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific device

patch.description: Partially updates the attributes of an existing device identified by its unique ID. The update can modify metadata, such as the devices name, category, or description, without requiring the full object.

requestBody.description: The data required to update an existing device

200.description: The device was successfully updated. The response includes the complete details of the updated device, such as its unique identifier, name, category, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or unsupported device type

422.description: Device could not be updated

delete.description: Deletes a specific device identified by its unique ID from the system. This action is irreversible and will remove the device and its associated data from the system.

get.description: Fetches a list of controls associated with a specific device. Controls represent actions that can be performed on the device, such as reboot or calibration.

200.description: A list of controls successfully retrieved. Each control includes its metadata (ID, name, and timestamps).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available device controls

post.description: Creates a new control associated with a specific device. Controls represent actions or commands that can be executed on the device, such as reboot or factory reset.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new device control

201.description: The control was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created control, such as its unique identifier, name, associated device, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or duplicate control name

422.description: Device control could not be created

post.summary: Create a new control for a device

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific control associated with a device using its unique ID. The response includes metadata such as the controls name, ID, associated device, and timestamps.

200.description: The control details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the controls metadata (ID, name, and timestamps).

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific control for a device

delete.description: Deletes a specific control associated with a device using its unique ID. This action is irreversible and removes the control from the system.
delete.summary: Delete a control for a device

get.description: Fetches a list of channels associated with a specific device. Each channel includes metadata (e.g., ID, name, category), associated controls, and properties.

200.description: A list of channels successfully retrieved. Each channel includes its metadata (ID, name, category), associated controls, and properties.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available channels for a device

post.description: Creates a new channel associated with a specific device. The channel can have attributes such as name, category, description, and optionally controls and properties.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new channel

201.description: The channel was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created channel, such as its unique identifier, name, category, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format, invalid request data, or unsupported channel type

422.description: Channel could not be created

post.summary: Create a new channel for a device

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific channel associated with a device using its unique ID. The response includes metadata, category, associated controls, and properties for the channel.

200.description: The channel details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the channels metadata (ID, name, category), associated controls, and properties.

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific channel for a device

patch.description: Partially updates the attributes of an existing channel associated with a device using its unique ID. The update can modify metadata such as the channels name, category, or description, without requiring the full object.

requestBody.description: The data required to update an existing channel

200.description: The channel was successfully updated. The response includes the complete details of the updated channel, such as its unique identifier, name, category, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or unsupported channel type

422.description: Channel could not be updated

patch.summary: Update an existing channel for a device

delete.description: Deletes a specific channel associated with a device using its unique ID. This action is irreversible and will remove the channel and its associated data from the system.

get.description: Fetches a list of controls associated with a specific channel of a device. Controls represent actions or commands that can be executed on the channel, such as reset or calibration.

200.description: A list of controls successfully retrieved. Each control includes its metadata (ID, name, and timestamps).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available controls for a devices channel

post.description: Creates a new control associated with a specific device channel. Controls represent actions or commands that can be executed on the channel, such as reset or calibration.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new channel control

201.description: The control was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created control, such as its unique identifier, name, associated channel, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or duplicate control name

422.description: Channel control could not be created

post.summary: Create a new control for a specific devices channel

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific control associated with a device channel using its unique ID. The response includes metadata such as the controls name, ID, associated channel, and timestamps.

200.description: The control details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the controls metadata (ID, name, and timestamps).

404.description: Device, channel, or control not found

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific control for a devices channel

delete.description: Deletes a specific control associated with a device channel using its unique ID. This operation is irreversible and permanently removes the control from the system.

404.description: Device, channel, or control not found

delete.summary: Delete a control for a device channel

get.description: Fetches a list of properties associated with a specific channel of a device. Properties represent attributes or measurements related to the channel, such as thermostat mode, temperature, or humidity.

200.description: A list of properties successfully retrieved. Each property includes its metadata (ID, name, category, data type, unit, and value), associated channel, and timestamps.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available properties for a devices channel

post.description: Creates a new property for a specific device channel. The property can include metadata such as category, permissions, data type, unit, and initial value. The response contains the full representation of the created property, including its unique identifier, associated channel, and metadata.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new property

201.description: The property was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created property, such as its unique identifier, name, category, data type, unit, and value, associated channel, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format, invalid request data, or unsupported property type

422.description: Channel property could not be created

post.summary: Create a new property for a specific devices channel

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific property associated with a device channel using its unique ID. The response includes metadata such as the propertys name, category, value, and associated channel.

200.description: The property details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the propertys metadata (ID, name, category, data type, unit, and value), associated channel, and timestamps.

404.description: Device, channel, or property not found

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific property for a devices channel

patch.description: Partially updates the details of a specific property associated with a device channel. This operation allows modifications to attributes such as the propertys name, value, or metadata, while preserving its unique identifier and association with the channel.

requestBody.description: The data required to update an existing property

200.description: The property was successfully updated. The response includes the complete details of the updated property, such as its unique identifier, name, category, data type, unit, and value, associated channel, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or unsupported property type

404.description: Device, channel, or property not found

422.description: Channel property could not be updated

patch.summary: Update and existing property for a specific devices channel

delete.description: Deletes a specific property associated with a device channel using its unique ID. This operation is irreversible and permanently removes the property from the system.

404.description: Device, channel, or property not found

delete.summary: Delete a property for a device channel

get.description: Retrieves historical timeseries data for a property within a specified time range. Supports optional downsampling via bucket parameter. Returns empty array if no data exists.

200.description: The timeseries data was successfully retrieved. The response includes the timeseries data for the property, including the timestamp, value, and metadata.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or invalid date format

404.description: Device, channel, or property not found

get.description: Fetches a list of channels in the system. The response includes metadata for each channel, such as its ID, name, category, associated device, controls, and properties.

200.description: A list of channels successfully retrieved. Each channel includes its metadata (ID, name, category), associated device, controls, and properties.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of available channels

post.description: Creates a new channel in the system. The channel can have attributes such as name, category, description, and an associated device. Optionally, controls and properties can also be defined during creation.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new channel

201.description: The channel was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created channel, such as its unique identifier, name, category, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid request data or unsupported channel type

422.description: Channel could not be created

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific channel using its unique ID. The response includes metadata, associated device information, controls, and properties for the channel.

200.description: The channel details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the channels metadata (ID, name, category), associated device, controls, and properties.

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific channel

patch.description: Partially updates the attributes of a specific channel using its unique ID. This allows modifications to properties such as the channels name, category, description, or associated controls and properties.

requestBody.description: The data required to update an existing channel

200.description: The channel was successfully updated. The response includes the complete details of the updated channel, such as its unique identifier, name, category, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or unsupported channel type

422.description: Channel could not be updated

delete.description: Deletes a specific channel using its unique ID. This operation is irreversible and permanently removes the channel from the system.

get.description: Fetches a list of all controls available for channels in the system. Each control represents an actionable operation associated with a channel. The response includes details such as the controls ID, name, associated channel, and timestamps.

200.description: A list of controls successfully retrieved. Each control includes its metadata (ID, name, and timestamps).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available channel controls

post.description: Allows the creation of a new control for a specific channel. A control represents an actionable operation or command associated with the channel. The response includes the complete details of the newly created control, including its ID, name, associated channel, and metadata.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new channel control

201.description: The control was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created control, such as its unique identifier, name, associated channel, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or duplicate control name

422.description: Channel control could not be created

200.description: The control details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the controls metadata (ID, name, and timestamps).

delete.description: Deletes a specific control associated with a channel using its unique ID. This operation is irreversible and permanently removes the control from the system.

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new property

get.description: Fetches a list of all users currently registered in the system. Each user includes their metadata such as ID, username, email, role, and profile information.

200.description: A list of users successfully retrieved. Each user includes their metadata (ID, username, email, role, and profile information).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all users

post.description: Creates a new user account in the system. The request requires user-specific attributes such as username, password, and optionally email and profile information. The response includes the full representation of the created user, including their unique identifier, username, email, role, and timestamps. Additionally, a Location header is provided with the URI of the newly created resource.

201.description: The user was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created user, such as its unique identifier, username, email, role, and timestamps.

400.description: Invalid request data or unsupported user data

422.description: Username or email already exists

get.description: Fetches the details of a specific user using their unique ID. The response includes the user's metadata such as ID, username, email, role, and profile information.

200.description: The user details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the user's metadata (ID, username, email, role, and profile information).

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific user

patch.description: Updates the details of an existing user using their unique ID. The request can include updates to username, email, password, role, or profile information. The response includes the complete updated representation of the user.

200.description: The user was successfully updated. The response includes the complete details of the updated user, such as its unique identifier, username, email, role, and timestamps.

422.description: Email already exists

delete.description: Deletes an existing user from the system using their unique ID. This operation is irreversible and will remove all associated user data. Users cannot delete their own account.

422.description: Cannot delete your own account

get.description: Fetches a list of all display instances currently registered in the system. Each display instance includes its metadata such as ID, UID, MAC address, version, build, and associated user.

200.description: A list of display instances successfully retrieved. Each display instance includes its metadata (ID, UID, MAC address, version, build, and associated user).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all display instances

post.description: Registers a new display instance in the system. The request requires display-specific attributes such as UID, MAC address, version, build, and associated user. The response includes the full representation of the created display instance, including its unique identifier, UID, MAC address, version, build, and timestamps. Additionally, a Location header is provided with the URI of the newly created resource.

201.description: The display instance was successfully created. The response includes the complete details of the newly created display instance, such as its unique identifier, UID, MAC address, version, build, and timestamps.

422.description: UID already exists or user not found

get.description: Fetches the details of a specific display instance using its unique ID. The response includes the display instance's metadata such as ID, UID, MAC address, version, build, and associated user.

200.description: The display instance details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the display instance's metadata (ID, UID, MAC address, version, build, and associated user).

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific display instance

patch.description: Updates the details of an existing display instance using its unique ID. The request can include updates to version, build, or display profile. The response includes the complete updated representation of the display instance.

200.description: The display instance was successfully updated. The response includes the complete details of the updated display instance, such as its unique identifier, UID, MAC address, version, build, and timestamps.

delete.description: Deletes an existing display instance from the system using its unique ID. This operation is irreversible and will remove all associated display instance data.

get.description: Fetches the details of a specific display instance using its unique identifier (UID). The response includes the display instance's metadata such as ID, UID, MAC address, version, build, and associated user.

200.description: The display instance details were successfully retrieved. The response includes the display instance's metadata (ID, UID, MAC address, version, build, and associated user).

get.summary: Retrieve a display instance by UID

put.description: Processes property update requests from third-party devices. This endpoint accepts an array of property update requests and returns the processing status for each property. Properties are updated asynchronously with a debounce delay to optimize performance.

requestBody.description: Array of device properties to update

200.description: Properties update request processed successfully. The response includes the status for each property update request.

400.description: Invalid request data or malformed property values

422.description: One or more properties could not be updated

500.description: Internal server error occurred while processing the request

put.summary: Demo webhook endpoint for third-party device property updates

post.summary: Fetch information about a Shelly NG device

get.description: Retrieves a comprehensive list of all Shelly Next-Generation device models that are supported by this plugin. Each entry includes device specifications, available components, and supported categories.

200.description: A list of supported Shelly NG devices was successfully retrieved. Each entry includes device specifications, available components, and supported categories.

get.summary: Get list of supported Shelly NG devices

post.description: Retrieves detailed information about a Shelly Generation 1 device by connecting to it using the provided hostname or IP address. The response includes device identification, firmware version, authentication settings, and reachability status.

requestBody.description: The data required to fetch device information

200.description: Device information was successfully retrieved. The response includes device identification, firmware version, authentication settings, and reachability status.

422.description: Device info model could not be created

post.summary: Fetch information about a Shelly V1 device

get.description: Retrieves a comprehensive list of all Shelly Generation 1 device models that are supported by this plugin. Each entry includes device specifications and supported categories.

200.description: A list of supported Shelly V1 devices was successfully retrieved. Each entry includes device specifications and supported categories.

get.summary: Get list of supported Shelly V1 devices

get.description: Retrieve all cards, optionally filtered by page

200.description: Cards retrieved successfully. The response includes a list of cards, optionally filtered by page ID.

get.summary: Get all cards

post.description: Create a new card with optional tiles and data sources

requestBody.description: The data required to create a new card

201.description: Card created successfully. The response includes the complete details of the newly created card with associated tiles and data sources.

422.description: Card could not be created

get.description: Retrieve a single card by its unique identifier

200.description: Card retrieved successfully. The response includes the complete card details with associated tiles and data sources.

get.summary: Get card by ID

patch.description: Update an existing card by ID

requestBody.description: The data to update the card with

200.description: Card updated successfully. The response includes the complete details of the updated card.

400.description: Invalid request data or UUID format

422.description: Card could not be updated

get.description: Streams a file (typically the ESM entry) from the discovered extension package directory. `asset_path` represents the remaining subpath inside the package and may include slashes.

parameters.name: asset_path
parameters.description: Subpath inside the package (may include slashes), e.g. `admin/index.js`.

get.summary: Serve an Admin extension asset (ESM)

info.title: FastyBird Smart Panel API
info.description:
Welcome to the **FastyBird Smart Panel API Documentation**!

This API is the central interface for integrating with the **FastyBird Smart Panel**, a modern, modular, and open-source platform for managing smart home devices and dashboards  all running on **your local hardware**, with no cloud dependency.

---

##  What Can This API Do?

The **FastyBird Smart Panel API** provides:

-  **Full Access to Smart Devices**  
  Manage devices, channels, and properties  read current values or send commands.

-  **Real-Time Monitoring & Sync**  
  Receive live updates from sensors, switches, and more through WebSocket connections.

-  **Third-Party Integration Support**  
  Easily connect external systems using standard API calls to sync data and trigger actions.

-  **Dashboard Customization**  
  Build or modify dashboard layouts, pages, tiles, and data sources dynamically via API.

-  **Local-First Control**  
  The entire stack is designed to run offline on your own network  secure, private, and fast.

---

##  Getting Started

>  **No cloud required. Everything runs locally.**

### 1. Install the Smart Panel  
Deploy the platform to a supported device like a Raspberry Pi or ReTerminal.

### 2. Connect & Configure Devices  
Add devices via the Admin App or API, either manually or through plugin integrations.

### 3. Interact via REST or WebSocket  
Use the API to read states, send commands, and subscribe to real-time updates.

---

##  API Modules Overview

### Devices API  
Manage devices and their structure:  
- Retrieve device/channel/property metadata  
- Send control commands  
- Sync state updates  

### Dashboard API  
Configure your Smart Panel UI:  
- Build pages and tiles  
- Add data sources  
- Organize device widgets  

---

##  API Usage Examples

Use this API to:

-  Read a temperature sensor value  
-  Toggle a light switch  
-  Display custom widgets  
-  Sync external device state  
-  Integrate with your own mobile or desktop app  

---

##  Authentication

Use token-based access when integrating external apps or third-party devices.  
See the [Authentication Guide](#) for details.

---

##  Frequently Asked

**Is the API cloud-based?**  
No  it runs entirely on your own hardware.

**Do I need to be online?**  
No  the API is designed for offline-first use.

**Can I control third-party devices?**  
Yes  use plugin-based extensions or the generic third-party interface.

**Does the Smart Panel support real-time updates?**  
Yes  WebSocket support is built-in.

---

##  Need Help?

-  [Join the FastyBird Community](https://discord.gg/H7pHN3hbqq)  
-  [Explore the Docs](https://smart-panel.fastybird.com/docs)  
-  [Report an issue](https://github.com/fastybird/smart-panel/issues)

---

 **Built with  by FastyBird**  Local-first, modular smart home integration.
info.summary: The FastyBird Smart Panel API provides a local, real-time interface for retrieving device data, monitoring statuses, and integrating third-party IoT systems. It enables seamless communication between the smart panel and connected devices, ensuring fast, private, and reliable interactions without cloud dependencies.

tags.name: Stats module
tags.description: Provides endpoints for retrieving aggregated runtime statistics from all backend modules. This includes system metrics (CPU, memory, disk, uptime), API performance data, WebSocket connection counts, dashboard entity statistics, and device activity summaries. Useful for monitoring backend performance and overall system health.

tags.name: Configuration module
tags.description: Endpoints related to configuring system settings, global parameters, and module-specific configurations.

tags.name: System module
tags.description: Provides endpoints to retrieve system-related information, including CPU load, memory usage, and system health status.

tags.name: Users module
tags.description: Endpoints for managing users, including user roles, permissions, and profile details.

tags.name: Auth module
tags.description: Endpoints related to user authentication, including registration, login, token validation, and session management.

tags.name: Dashboard module
tags.description: A collection of endpoints that provide dashboard-related functionalities, acting as a central module for handling tile interactions.

tags.name: Devices module
tags.description: A collection of endpoints that provide device-related functionalities, acting as a central module for handling device interactions.

tags.name: Weather module
tags.description: A collection of endpoints that provide weather-related functionalities, such as retrieving forecasts and current conditions.

tags.name: Devices Home-Assistant plugin
tags.description: Endpoints for interacting with Home Assistant devices and their states. This plugin allows discovery, inspection, and potential adoption of Home Assistant devices into the Smart Panel ecosystem.

tags.name: Devices Shelly NG plugin
tags.description: Endpoints for interacting with Shelly Next-Generation (NG) devices and their states. This plugin allows discovery, inspection, and potential adoption of Shelly Next-Generation devices into the Smart Panel ecosystem.

tags.name: Devices Shelly V1 plugin
tags.description: Endpoints for interacting with Shelly Generation 1 (V1) devices and their states. This plugin allows discovery, inspection, and potential adoption of Shelly Gen 1 devices into the Smart Panel ecosystem.

tags.name: Devices Third-Party plugin
tags.description: Endpoints for interacting with Third-party devices and their states.

tags.name: Pages cards plugin
tags.description: A collection of endpoints that provide cards pages-related functionalities, acting as a central card plugin for handling tile interactions.
